etymology.description: Phonetic: 麻(麻) (má) + Semantic: 鬼(鬼) (guǐ, "demon") = represents a demonic or magical concept -> demon; magic
etymology.interpretation: This character combines the phonetic 麻(麻) (má), contributing the pronunciation, with the semantic 鬼(鬼) (guǐ, "demon"), emphasizing the supernatural and demonic meaning, creating a word associated with magic or demons.

examples.chinese: 黑夜降临时(黑夜降臨時)，魔鬼出没于街巷(魔鬼出沒於街巷)。
examples.pinyin: Hēiyè jiànglín shí, móguǐ chūmò yú jiēxiàng.
examples.english: When night falls, demons appear in the alleys.

examples.chinese: 古老传说中(古老傳說中)，魔姬迷惑凡人(魔姬迷惑凡人)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔlǎo chuánshuō zhōng, mó jī míhuò fánrén.
examples.english: In ancient legends, a demon maiden bewilders mortals.

examples.chinese: 人心易被魔诱惑(人心易被魔誘惑)。
examples.english: The human heart is easily tempted by demons.
